bibl.title: Letter from T.H.D. Griffitts to Henry Rose Carter, August 16, 1921

div1.p: Griffitts thanks Carter for lending him memos. He reports on the results of impounded water work in North Carolina and Virginia.

div1.head: Letter from T.H.D. Griffitts to Henry Rose Carter, August 16, 1921
div1.opener:
Fireproof
WILMINGTON HOTEL CO.
OWNERS
Luxury without Extravagance
SLEEP IN SAFETY
Hotel Wilmington
EUROPEAN
Wilmington, N.C.
August 16, 1921.
Dear Doctor Carter:
div1.p:
Let me confess that I'm
ashamed of my not having
acknowledged your goodness
in writing me on July 12 and
enclosing the two memo in re
impounded water -- Badin and
Lock 8, Coosa River. I have
follow into the bad habit of
trying to take care of correspond-
ence the little time I'm in
the Norfolk office, and for the
post month I have been these
little. Memphis, for instance, wants
everything typed, and I've neglected
more than I should, consequently.

I am exceedingly glad to get
your Badin notes of more than
6 years ago. In most respects
the forecasts came true. There
is scant doubt, however,
Fireproof
WILMINGTON HOTEL CO.
OWNERS
Luxury without Extravagance
SLEEP IN SAFETY
Hotel Wilmington
EUROPEAN
Wilmington, N.C.
2
but that Palmerville gained by
the impoundment. So far, in
my examinations there, I have
been able to find breeding only
in one small area of the
old Canal and this not to
an extent to do harm to
Palmerville.

There is one caution about
lowering and raising water levels.
Even in lowering small ponds
care should be taken not
to lower to an allowable
degree all at once. Do you
recall the mill Pond at
Morrison, with much vegeta-
ting flat land at the upper end
where land gross spring up
rapidly and endangeredincurred danger in raising
it. It was better to lower by
intervals.

Fireproof
WILMINGTON HOTEL CO.
OWNERS

Luxury without Extravagance
SLEEP IN SAFETY
Hotel Wilmington
EUROPEAN
Wilmington, N.C.

Again at Va. Beach last year
Gaye lowered Lake Holly, it
came dry weather and could
not raise the pond. The “mariti-
me” grass flashed to the surface
looking like a meadow and
every inch a “quad.” This, of
course would not happen on
the pools of the larger pro-
jects.

I regret that I wont be able
to spend much time on impound-
ed water this season. Have been
able to spend two days on the
Big Bethel, or rather, the Harwood
mill, pond near Harperville,
and the new Skiff creek
pond. The latter, you recall
was almost completely taken
care of under our direction
and for the most part is not
producing.

Fireproof
WILMINGTON HOTEL CO.
OWNERS

Luxury without Extravagance
SLEEP IN SAFETY
Hotel Wilmington
EUROPEAN
Wilmington, N.C.

I have been able to get a
start in three counties in Virginia
on rural malaria.- Greensville
County, James City County and
Isle of Wight. In J. C. Co.
every house (some not at home,
of course) has been visited, get-
ting principally: No. in family over
14 yrs., under 14 yrs., cases of mala-
ria 1920, cases thus for 1921, loss
of time from (a) work, (b) school; type
of house; No. windows; No. *screened
No. doors; No screened; chimneys “not
in use in summer”, etc. The mosquito
- malaria story has been told to all
and your “primer” left with them.
Strange enough this “cradle of
American malaria” (?) -- showed
only 55 cases of malaria out of
2,200 people -- mostly in the
Chickahominy region.

* Any attempt at screening - also “poor”, “good”
porches screened etc.

Fireproof
WILMINGTON HOTEL CO.
OWNERS

Luxury without Extravagance
SLEEP IN SAFETY
Hotel Wilmington
EUROPEAN
Wilmington, N.C.

Regardless of “less easy times”, the
man in Greensville County is
getting some action in the way
of screened homes.

The work in Isle of Wight
got a jolt early, as Dr. Harper
was transferred to T.B. work at
Catawba. An engineer, Mr.
Clarkson is continuing the
work - largely census and educa-
tional - in I. of W.

In North Carolina, something
is going in Edgecombe and
am now in New Hanover for
a few days for something in
Co. wide work -- but somewhat
dissimilar. Will return to Nor-
folk about 19th.

Fireproof
WILMINGTON HOTEL CO.
OWNERS

Luxury without Extravagance
SLEEP IN SAFETY
Hotel Wilmington
EUROPEAN
Wilmington, N.C.

The kiddies would all send
love. M. T. and Jack have
just finished summer school. The
former was behind, so Jack tag-
ged along for company. They
both made the 5th grade. The
boy is 8. I am not rushing him-
he simply makes it with no strain

Wishing you and Miss Laura
the pleasantest vacation,

closer.seg:
P. S.
At your suggestion I am keeping
your memo on Lock 8, Coosa
River and returning herewith the
Badin memo. If your Washing
ton address is changed from
California St. wont you please
let me know?
G-
